Package game

Interface Destroyable

All Known Implementing Classes:
HighGround, Mature, Sapling, Sprout, Tree, Wall
public interface Destroyable
It is an interface that will be implemented by those class that are destroyable when the Player is invincible. The reason to create this interface instead of just directly putting the following two methods in Tree class is because this kind of design allow for extension. What I meant is that what if there are more types of ground (regardless of the ground type) that are destroyable in the future, and they perform the same operations after it is being destroyed (i.e., also change to dirt and drop coins). Therefore, if there is such situation happen in the future, we can just let that particular class to implements this interface. Hence, this approach is better.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    default void breakToDirt​(Location currentLocation)
    A default interface method that change the ground type of current location to dirt
    default void convertCoin​(Location currentLocation, int coinValue)
    A default interface method that create a coin instance on that location

  • Method Details

    • breakToDirt

      default void breakToDirt​(Location currentLocation)
      A default interface method that change the ground type of current location to dirt
      Parameters:
      currentLocation - the current location of the destroyable instance
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if currentLocation is null

    • convertCoin

      default void convertCoin​(Location currentLocation, int coinValue)
      A default interface method that create a coin instance on that location
      Parameters:
      currentLocation - the current location of the destroyable instance
      coinValue - the value of coin that drop at that location
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if currentLocation is null
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if coinValue is not 5
